thread.title: Boston Yeti returns, eats donuts
thread.title_full: Boston Yeti returns, eats donuts - The Boston Globe

author: bostonglobe
title: Boston Yeti returns, eats donuts

organizations.name: union square donuts the boston yeti

text:
By Nicole Fleming Globe Correspondent February 10, 2017
UNION SQUARE DONUTS
The Boston Yeti stopped by Union Square Donuts in Somerville.
Little is known about the diet of Abominable Snowmen, but the first blizzard in two years brought some insight: the Boston Yeti has a sweet tooth. He was spotted at Union Square Donuts in Somerville Thursday morning.
In the midst of Boston’s memorably miserable snowmageddon of 2015, the Boston Yeti first appeared as a tall, furry figure who wandered the streets and occasionally shoveled snow for winter-weary Bostonians. Residents credited him with keeping the public semi-sane during the frustration caused by that merciless barrage of snowstorms.
Advertisement
The Boston Yeti — social media-savvy as far as Himalayan creatures go, with more than 8,000 Twitter followers — stopped by the popular doughnut shop Thursday morning and posed for selfies.
Donuts and snowstorms go so well together! @UnionSqDonuts @BostInno @BostonTweet #bosnow #snowday #snowstorm2017 #bostonyeti pic.twitter.com/ZRsBHfeOWA
— Boston Yeti 2015 (@BostonYeti2015) February 9, 2017 Swing by the somerville shop for some pre-blizzard donuts with @BostonYeti2015 pic.twitter.com/CqOPoxTnvJ
— Union Square Donuts (@UnionSqDonuts) February 9, 2017 My first yeti selfie!! @BostonYeti2015 @UnionSqDonuts pic.twitter.com/TEmc520Xdn
— Gary Vogel (@GVogel18) February 9, 2017 The Boston Yeti also tweeted a photo of himself holding a sign that reads, “Good is coming.”
Boston! Good is coming in March. Stay tuned! For now, enjoy this #SnowDay2017 @ericfisher @BostInno #snowstorm #ad #noreaster #thundersnow pic.twitter.com/y9U9KsYGWx
— Boston Yeti 2015 (@BostonYeti2015) February 9, 2017 Get Fast Forward in your inbox: Forget yesterday's news. Get what you need today in this early-morning email. Sign Up Thank you for signing up! Sign up for more newsletters here Hopefully “good” doesn’t mean a repeat of winter 2015?
Nicole Fleming can be reached at nicole.fleming@globe.com . Follow her on Twitter @GirlEatsBoston .
